questions.question: Which UNESCO site in South America is known for its well-preserved Inca terraces and was declared a World Heritage Site in 1983?
questions.context: This site is perched high in the Andes Mountains and was built in the 15th century, believed to be an estate for the Inca emperor.

questions.question: Which capital city hosts La Sagrada Familia, a basilica known for its architectural grandeur designed by Antoni Gaud√≠, started in 1882 and still under construction?
questions.context: It is one of the most visited monuments in Spain, with its elaborate facades and towers drawing millions of tourists every year.

questions.question: What historical battle site is located on the continent of Europe and was the scene of Napoleon's final defeat in 1815?
questions.context: This battlefield marks a decisive point in European history where the Duke of Wellington's forces ended Napoleon's rule.

questions.question: In which city can you find the Louvre, famously known for housing the Mona Lisa and Venus de Milo, and once used as a fortress?
questions.context: Established in 1793, this museum is one of the largest and one of the most visited in the world, showcasing works from ancient civilizations to the 19th century.

questions.question: Which NASA space exploration site in the United States is known for launching Apollo 11, the first successful manned mission to the moon, in 1969?
questions.context: Located on Merritt Island, this site has been the primary launch center of human spaceflight for the United States and continues to be a hub of space science.
